question: 律動
sourceMnemonic:
The <kanji>law</kanji> of <kanji>move</kanji>ment is governed by <vocabulary>rhythm</vocabulary>. Imagine moving around to a boss beat. As you move, you start to feel the rhythm in your step. Go ahead and walk around your room and feel this rhythm. 

Note that <ja>リズム</ja> is a much more common word to use for "rhythm," but you may see the kanji version sometimes in formal writing. One thing you will see more often is <ja>律動的</ja> which means "rhythmic."
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
